title: Erdős Problem #960: Ordinary Lines and Collinear Ramsey Thresholds
description: Given n points with no k collinear, determine the threshold f_{r,k}(n) of ordinary lines guaranteeing an r-point all-ordinary subset. Is f_{r,k}(n) = o(n²)? Turán bound: f ≤ (1-1/(r-1))n²/2+1. OPEN.

overview.historicalContext: Erdős Problem #960 from [Er84] asks about the threshold of ordinary lines needed to guarantee an all-ordinary r-subset in point configurations with no k collinear. Turán's theorem provides an upper bound. The problem connects to the Sylvester-Gallai theorem and ordinary lines in discrete geometry.
overview.problemStatement: Let r, k >= 2. For n points with no k collinear, determine f_{r,k}(n): the minimum number of ordinary lines guaranteeing r points whose C(r,2) connecting lines are all ordinary. Is f_{r,k}(n) = o(n²)? OPEN.
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines PointConfig, NoKCollinear, IsOrdinaryLine, AllOrdinary, and the threshold function via sSup. The main conjecture is stated as little-o growth. The Turán upper bound is axiomatized.
keyInsights: An ordinary line passes through exactly 2 points of the configuration
The threshold f_{r,k}(n) counts how many ordinary lines force an all-ordinary r-subset
The conjecture asks for subquadratic growth, or even linear growth
Related to Sylvester-Gallai and ordinary lines problems

sections.title: Part I: Point Configurations and Collinearity
sections.summary: Defines PointConfig structure and NoKCollinear predicate.

sections.title: Part III: All-Ordinary Subsets
sections.summary: Defines AllOrdinary: every pair in a subset determines an ordinary line.

sections.title: Part IV: The Threshold Function
sections.summary: Defines threshold(r, k, n) via sSup over configurations without all-ordinary r-subsets.

sections.title: Part V: The Main Conjecture
sections.summary: Defines ErdosConjecture960_littleo (f = o(n²)) and ErdosConjecture960_linear (f ≪ n). Axiom erdos_960.

sections.title: Part VI: Turán Upper Bound
sections.summary: Axioms: turan_upper_bound (Turán's theorem), trivial_bound (at most C(n,2) lines).

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #960 asks for the threshold of ordinary lines guaranteeing all-ordinary r-subsets. Turán's theorem provides an upper bound, but whether the threshold is subquadratic or linear remains open.
conclusion.implications: Resolution would connect ordinary line theory to Ramsey-type phenomena in discrete geometry.
openQuestions: What is the exact behavior for small r and k?
How does the threshold relate to Sylvester-Gallai type results?
